titleStmt.title: To the Painter, after he had finish'd Dorinda's Picture.
titleStmt.author: John Pomfret

bibl.title: To the Painter, after he had finish'd Dorinda's Picture.
bibl.author: John Pomfret

front.head: To the Painter, after he had finish'd Dorinda's Picture.

lg.l: , thou hast perform'd what Man can do,
Only self more Charms can shew.
Bold are thy Strokes, and delicate each Touch,
But still the Beauties of her Face are such
As cannot justly be describ'd; tho' all
In her, and in thy Picture, we may view
The utmost Nature, or that Art can do,
Each is a Master-piece, design'd so well
That future Times may strive to parallel,
But neither Art nor Nature's able to excel.
